raw_comment:
Notices:
- If your parents have a higher income and if you have a relative who went to an elite college then you have a very high chance of being accepted into that college too. 
- Legacy applicants who have parents who have lower income have about the same chance of being accepted as non-legacy applicants who have parents who have a lot higher income.

Wonders:
- What would this graph would look like if you put colleges from today on here and how would it would compare to the data from 1999 to 2015.
- Is there anything that could change about the bias towards parents with higher income of legacy status?

Relates:
- This relates to me and my community because I know people that are applying to college and it is crazy to think about how elite colleges near me might be making these biased decisions based of off the parents income and legacy status.

Headline:
- How the college admission system is still rigged
